greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of perfect matchings of an n X (n+1) Aztec rectangle with the third vertex in the topmost row removed.
comment: For n > 1, a(n) is the number of birooted graphs on n labeled nodes. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 23 2020
reference: N. Elkies, G. Kuperberg, M. Larsen and J. Propp, Alternating sign matrices and domino tilings, Journal of Algebraic Combinatorics {\bf 1}, 111-132, 219-234 (1992).
link: M. Ciucu, Enumeration of perfect matchings in graphs with reflective symmetry, J. Combin. Theory Ser. A 77 (1997), no. 1, 67-97.
H. Helfgott and I. M. Gessel, Enumeration of tilings of diamonds and hexagons with defects, arXiv:math/9810143 [math.CO], 1998.
C. Krattenthaler, Schur function identities and the number of perfect matchings of Aztec holey rectangles, arXiv:math/9712204 [math.CO], 1997.
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Feb 21 2005
